citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of two new methane-producing cocci: Methanogenium olentangyi sp. nov., and Methanococcus deltae, sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Methanococcus deltae sp. nov., Corder et al.
Methanococcus deltae (del.'tae G. gen. n. deltae of the delta)
Morphology: Irregular cocci, cell diameter 1.0-1.5 μm.
Cell walls sensitive to 0.001% SDS and distilled water.
Colonial morphology: Circular, shiny, greenish-yellow with dark centers, convex.
Physiology: Strict anaerobe, CO2 plus H2, and formate serve as substrates for growth and methane production.
Nutrition: Obligate marine methanogen, requires 3 % NaCl for growth, optimum NaCl concentration is 3.5-4.0 %.
Acetate, trypticase, yeast extract, vitamins not required for growth.
Serology: Cross-reacts weakly (1+) with Methanococcus vannielli antiserum.
The description of the type strain is the same as for the species.
